meta.title: About Us - Placer Forest School
meta.description: Learn about Placer Forest School's approach to nature-based education, our philosophy, and the team behind our forest school program in Rocklin, CA.

header.title: About Placer Forest School
header.subtitle: Nurturing children through nature-based learning and respectful parenting principles

sections.title: Our Philosophy
sections.content: At Placer Forest School, we believe that children learn best when they are free to explore, discover, and connect with the natural world. Our approach is grounded in research-based practices that honor children's innate curiosity and support their natural development through unstructured outdoor play.

sections.title: Our Approach
sections.content: We are inspired by leading educators and researchers in the field of child development and outdoor education. Our program integrates the wisdom of Angela Hanscom's sensory-rich outdoor experiences, Janet Lansbury's respectful parenting practices, and Peter Gray's insights on the importance of free play in learning.
highlights: Connection with nature as a teacher
Respect for each child's individual pace

sections.title: Our Learning Environment
sections.content: Our forest school meets in a beautiful open space in the Lincoln/Rocklin area, rich with natural features that invite exploration and learning. The location includes boulders for climbing, trees for shelter and imagination, and seasonal creeks that provide endless opportunities for discovery.
